summary: This document is an email chain from October 2021, forwarding a January 2020 exchange between an FBI Special Agent and an FAA Law Enforcement Assistance Program (LEAP) official. The FAA official provides detailed aircraft registration and ownership information for several helicopters and jets associated with Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, including tail numbers, ownership histories, and signatures of individuals involved in the transactions.

persons.name: Lawrence P. Visoski, Jr.
persons.context: Listed as the person who signed the current registration for helicopter N722JE (Air Ghislaine 2) for Hyperion Air LLC in July 2019.

persons.name: James D. Clark
persons.context: Signed the paperwork as the seller for ASI Wings LLC when it sold helicopter N722JE to Hyperion Air LLC in June 2019.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Signed the registration for helicopter N722JE when it was registered by Freedom Air International, Inc. in August 2010. Also signed as the seller for Hyperion Air, Inc. when it sold helicopter N331JE to Hyperion Air, LLC in August 2013.

persons.name: Larry Visoski
persons.context: Signed the registration for helicopter N722JE when it was registered by Air Ghislaine, Inc. in December 2008.

persons.name: William P. Merriam Jr
persons.context: Signed as the seller for Bovale Developments, Inc. when it sold helicopter N331JE on March 6, 2012.

persons.name: Ghislaine Noelle Maxwell
persons.context: Identified by the FBI as the subject who personally piloted a helicopter (N722JE/Air Ghislaine 2) and was a frequent passenger on jets associated with Jeffrey Epstein. Her pilot certificate issue date is noted.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned by the FBI agent as someone Ghislaine Maxwell traveled with frequently, and that some of the aircraft are associated with him.

persons.name: Van Heurck
persons.context: The FAA official asks the FBI if this surname has any relevance to the case, suggesting they were a potential pilot of one of the aircraft.

connections.description: The FBI agent states Maxwell traveled with Epstein frequently on the aircraft in question.
Visoski signed the registration for helicopter N722JE, which is nicknamed 'Air Ghislaine 2' and associated with Maxwell.
Visoski signed aircraft registration documents as a representative of the registered owner, Hyperion Air LLC.
Indyke signed aircraft registration documents for Freedom Air International, Inc.

events.title: FBI Request for Aircraft Information
events.description: An FBI Special Agent from the New York Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking task force sends a detailed request to the FAA for information on aircraft associated with Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: FAA Provides Aircraft Registration Details
events.description: An FAA official from the Law Enforcement Assistance Program (LEAP) responds with extensive registration, ownership history, and LLC documents for multiple helicopters and jets, including N722JE and N331JE.

events.title: Purchase of Sikorsky S-76C (N722JE)
events.description: Aircraft later known as N722JE (Air Ghislaine 2) is purchased from Sikorsky by Air Ghislaine, Inc.

events.title: Purchase of Helicopter by Hyperion Air LLC
events.description: Hyperion Air LLC purchases the Sikorsky S-76C (N722JE) from ASI Wings LLC.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's Pilot Certificate Issued
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is issued a Private Pilot certificate.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively investigating Ghislaine Maxwell's use of private aircraft, including a helicopter she personally piloted (N722JE, nicknamed 'Air Ghislaine 2') and jets she traveled on with Jeffrey Epstein.

Detailed ownership chains for aircraft reveal a network of LLCs (Hyperion Air LLC, Air Ghislaine Inc., Freedom Air International, ASI Wings LLC, Bovale Developments Inc.) used to register and transfer helicopters N722JE and N331JE.

Several individuals, including Lawrence P. Visoski Jr., Darren K. Indyke, James D. Clark, and William P. Merriam Jr., signed critical aircraft registration and sale documents, establishing a paper trail for the assets.

The FAA official handling the request exercised discretion due to the 'high profile' nature of the case and took steps to protect personally identifiable information (PII) and medical privacy in the documents provided.
The document indicates the FBI was seeking passenger manifests for these aircraft, highlighting an interest in identifying other travelers associated with Maxwell and Epstein.
